intro: Calycera sessiliflora, commonly known as the sessile-flower calycera, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in early spring. Calycera sessiliflora is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural studies.
